intro: Arabis ambigua, commonly known as the common rockcress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants like mustard and cress. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas and has small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are lobed and often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Arabis ambigua is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
